conclusion: The question asks for the number of moments when the speed of the particle is 5 m/s.
Speed is the absolute value of velocity, and velocity is the derivative of displacement with respect to time.
Find points where the absolute value of the derivative of the displacement function is equal to 5.
The graph shows a displacement curve starting at 10 m, decreasing to -10 m, then increasing back to 0 m.
The slope of the curve at any point represents the velocity of the particle at that time.
Points where the slope of the curve is equal to 5 or -5 are where the speed is 5 m/s.
There are two points where the slope of the curve is equal to 5 or -5, at approximately t = 1 s and t = 3 s.
There are two moments when the speed of the particle is 5 m/s.
